question: Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the first component of the normalized vector?
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the second component of the normalized vector?
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the first component of the normalized vector? Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-5 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the first component of the normalized vector?

Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}2 & 2 & -1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the third component of the normalized vector? Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}4 & -3\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the second component of the normalized vector?
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}0 & 5 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the second component of the normalized vector?
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 0 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the first component of the normalized vector?

Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}-2 & -2 & -1\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the second component of the normalized vector? Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
Let $\mathbf{u} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Normalize $\mathbf{u}$ to create a unit vector. What is the first component of the normalized vector? Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
